byline.contributor: Hopewell Chin’ono reported from Harare, and Norimitsu Onishi from Johannesburg.
byline.original: By HOPEWELL CHIN'ONO and NORIMITSU ONISHI

abstract: Zimbabweans have taken to using flight tracking apps to follow movements of Pres Robert Mugabe's plane in effort to glean clues about frail leader's health; many citizens are anxious about state of nation after leader of 36 years dies.

headline.print_headline: Zimbabweans, Seeking Any Clue to Mugabe’s Health, Try Tracking His Plane
headline.main: Zimbabwe Follows Robert Mugabe’s Health by Following His Plane

snippet: Government officials reveal little about the 92-year-old president’s condition or his travels, so Zimbabweans use apps to scour his flight path for clues....
lead_paragraph: Government officials reveal little about the 92-year-old president’s condition or his travels, so Zimbabweans use apps to scour his flight path for clues.
